definition: point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: One-Inch arrived at the house of one of England's great lords.
sentences.chinese: 小不點在英國一個君主的屋子前停了下來。

sentences.english: The poor ploughman and his wife were very proud of their little son.
sentences.chinese: 老兩口爲他們的小不點兒子感到十分自豪。

sentences.english: But I am such a little fellow I need somebody to help me distribute them.
sentences.chinese: 但我是這樣一個小不點兒，需要有人幫我發送它們。

sentences.english: But after a moment, a wee, little mouse stepped forward.
sentences.chinese: 稍後，一個小不點的鼠鼠走向跟前。

sentences.english: Either way hearing your voice can be soothing to the little peanut.
sentences.chinese: 不管怎樣，能聽到你的聲音都會讓小不點心情舒緩。

sentences.english: She was now my little girl.
sentences.chinese: 她現在是我的小不點了。

sentences.english: Your little passenger is headed for a major growth spurt.
sentences.chinese: 小不點正朝着一個重要的生長突增發展。

sentences.english: Lookat these little apartments right here.
sentences.chinese: 瞧瞧這些小不點的公寓。

sentences.english: One-Inch pulled out his sword and attacked the monster.
sentences.chinese: 小不點拔出他的劍開始和怪物搏鬥。

sentences.english: The little fellow will grow up.
sentences.chinese: 那小不點兒會成長起來的。

sentences.english: This pint-size powerhouse of a country mainly supports itself through contributions from Catholics around the world, and though tourism.
sentences.chinese: 這樣一個小不點兒國家卻擁有強大的權力。

sentences.english: You mean the little tiny guitars?
sentences.chinese: 你是指那種小不點四絃琴？

sentences.english: The little boy can already do simple problems in addition and subtraction.
sentences.chinese: 這個小不點孩子都已經會做簡單的加減法問題了。

sentences.english: One-Inch was determined to kill the monster. He practiced with his sword in preparation.
sentences.chinese: 小不點決定殺死這隻怪物，於是他用他的劍練武功。

definition: young married woman/mistress/(fig.) punching bag/(old) child bride
lit. cherry mouth (idiom)/fig. a delicate, ruby-lipped mouth
dimple/also written 酒渦|酒涡[jiu3 wo1]
voice change (at puberty)/to alter one's voice (deliberately)/to sound different (when angry etc)
